One of the greatest challenges in yellow fever is the diagnosis of disease, because symptoms can be mistaken for other diseases such as respiratory, digestive or urinary infections
37 . Therefore, due the lack of symptoms specificity in the early stages of YF, the differential diagnosis is imperative, because yellow fever can be easily mistaken for other hemorrhagic diseases, such as leptospirosis, dengue fever, malaria and viral hepatitis
2 . Another important point is that YF shares the same vector and geographic areas of other tropical diseases, such as zika, dengue and chikungunya infections
1 , 5 .
